In some limited cases, domains that might appear as available in whois might not actually be available as they could be already registered and the whois not yet updated and/or they could be part of the Restricted list. Additionally, domains currently or previously used as extensions in 3rd level domains will not be available for registration in the 2nd level. Moreover, the certificates were for subdomains with a structure that seems unusual and not typically related to a legitimate e-commerce or business website. Combining this information with the WHOIS data and the content from the ExtractText action, I believe I have enough information to make a conclusion. I now know the final answer.
